quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 5 Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: 5.1: Exponential Functions
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Properties and behavior of exponential graphs

questions.question: In the function $f(x) = b^x$, what are the restrictions on the base $b$?
questions.explanation: The base must be positive to ensure the output is always real, and if $b=1$, the function is just a constant line $y=1$.

questions.question: Which of the following functions represents exponential decay?
questions.explanation: Decay occurs when the base is between 0 and 1.

questions.question: What is the horizontal asymptote of the basic exponential function $f(x) = 3^x$?
questions.explanation: As $x$ becomes a very large negative number, $3^x$ approaches (but never reaches) zero.

questions.question: The range of the basic function $f(x) = 2^x$ is:
questions.explanation: The function stays strictly above the x-axis, so the range is all positive real numbers excluding zero.

questions.question: What transformation moves the graph of $f(x) = b^x$ three units to the left?
questions.explanation: Adding to the input $x$ causes a horizontal shift; $+3$ moves it left.

questions.question: Which point is on the graph of every function of the form $f(x) = b^x$ (assuming no translations)?
questions.explanation: Any non-zero base raised to the power of 0 is 1.

questions.question: As $x \to \infty$, which function grows the fastest?
questions.explanation: Exponential growth eventually surpasses polynomial and linear growth regardless of the coefficients.

questions.question: True or False: The graph of $f(x) = -2^x$ has a horizontal asymptote at $y = 0$.
questions.explanation: The negative sign is a reflection across the x-axis, but the boundary it approaches (zero) remains the same.

scoreMessages.90: Great start to Unit 5! You have the 'power' over exponents.
scoreMessages.70: Good work. Remember: negative exponents create fractions, not negative results.
scoreMessages.50: Watch your intercepts and asymptotes carefully.
scoreMessages.0: Review the basic properties and shapes of exponential functions.
